Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 11:37AM marshmellow wrote: I agree with mraven.....try not to worry too much....and be careful with exactly how much reading you do online too....it may only increase your anxiety because you may very well be reading things that don't even apply to you, but it may cause you to believe it applies to you. The odds are very much in your favor that all is well! :) Hang in there!
Posts.Title: 23 years old and need ultrasound...help! bartosma noworriesbehappy

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2009 06:11PM - edited Aug 4, 2009 06:12PM by marshmellow I had/have a similar situation....have seen numerous doctors...breast surgeon...2 ultrasounds...both which just show denser tissue...and I have numerous cysts (that I can't even feel) in other locations. I definitely have a bit of a fluctuation with my cycles as well - which I am told is a very good sign! I am 29.
Posts.Title: 24 and a little worried... JillianA chef127

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2009 01:05PM - edited Mar 5, 2009 01:07PM by marshmellow I'm 28 and I also have a lump (and have had it for probably 7 years that i know of) that is due to hormonal change as well....I've been to a handful of doctors and surgeons about it over the years and its always the same diagnosis....its a piece of reactive tissue that gets prominent right before my period, then as soon as my period starts it starts to go down. try your best not to touch it all the time...that can make it even more 'reactive' and 'tender' as your cycle progresses. vitamin E is also recommended for hormonal and fibrocystic breasts. its always good to see a doctor though so that you can know whats what.
